meanings.definition: Refuse to acknowledge or accept responsibility for
meanings.sent1: She disavowed any involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent2: He disavowed his role in the argument.
meanings.sent3: The cat disavowed knocking over the vase, blaming it on the dog instead.
meanings.sent4: The politician disavowed the scandal, claiming it was all a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The student disavowed cheating on the test, insisting it was a mistake.

meanings.definition: Deny any connection with or support for
meanings.sent1: They disavowed the rumors spreading about them.
meanings.sent2: She disavowed the controversial statement made by her friend.
meanings.sent3: The superhero disavowed the villain's evil plan, vowing to stop it.
meanings.sent4: The company disavowed the faulty product, promising a better version soon.
meanings.sent5: He disavowed the negative comments, focusing on the positive feedback instead.
